dfischer.utils

Class PerformanceDataRecordBasicFailureMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.PerformanceDataRecordBasicFailureMap

  • public class PerformanceDataRecordBasicFailureMap
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains basic information about every failed URL call which occured during the load test execution.
    Only a few data are collected per failed URL call by this class:
    1. The status type of the failed URL call
    2. The HTTP status code of the failed URL call
    3. The time in milliseconds when the error has occurred (since January 1, 1970)
    For optimization an internal hashmap is used which keys are instances of PerformanceDataRecordBasicFailureMapKey (status type and status code) and which values are instances of PerformanceDataRecordBasicFailureMapValue (error times).
    See Also:
    HttpTestURL.getStatusType(), HttpTestURL.getStatus(), PerformanceDataRecordBasicFailureMapKey, PerformanceDataRecordBasicFailureMapValue

      • setErrorStatusTypeTranslation

        public void setErrorStatusTypeTranslation(int errorStatusType,
                                 java.lang.String errorStatusTypeText)
        Allows to override the information text of an error status type.
        Note: the information text for a particular error status type can be overriden only once during a load test and remain after that constant until the load test job is completed.
        Parameters:
        errorStatusType - the error status type
        errorStatusTypeText - the new information text of the error status type
        See Also:
        HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_WRONG_HTTP_STATUS, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_WRONG_MIME_TYPE, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_WRONG_CONTENT_SIZE, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_NO_CONTENT_RECEIVED, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_CONTENT_STRING_NOT_FOUND, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_UNEXPECTED_CONTENT_STRING_FOUND, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_USER_SPECIFIC_TEST_FAILED, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_HEADER_STRING_NOT_FOUND, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_UNEXPECTED_HEADER_STRING_FOUND, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_ABORTED_BY_INLINE_SCRIPT, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_0, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_1, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_2, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_3, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_4, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_5, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_6, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_7, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_8, HttpTestURL.STATUS_TYPE_PLUGIN_ERROR_CODE_9

      • removeErrorStatusTypeTranslation

        public void removeErrorStatusTypeTranslation(int errorStatusType)
        Internal. Do not use this method.

      • getErrorStatusTypeTranslationTable

        public ErrorStatusTypeTranslationTable getErrorStatusTypeTranslationTable()
        Get a translation table which contains the overriden information texts of one or several error status types.
        The <keys> of the table are referencing error status types.
        The <values> of the table are referencing the overriden information texts.
        Note: normally, this table is empty and contains no entries.
        See Also:
        setErrorStatusTypeTranslation(int errorStatusType, String errorStatusTypeText)

      • getMergedStatusTypeMap

        public PerformanceDataRecordBasicFailureMap getMergedStatusTypeMap()
        Merges all entries with the same status type to one entry - except entries with the status type "Wrong HTTP Status Received" which are not merged.
        Note 1: the current instance of the map is not modified, instead of that a new instance is returned.
        Note 2: the HTTP status code of the merged status types contain no longer a valid unique value (loss of data) - except for the status type "Wrong HTTP Status Received".
        Returns:
        new instance with merged status types - except that key-value pairs with the status type "Wrong HTTP Status Received" are not merged (stored as unchaged copy).

        Adds all data of another basic failure map into a target basic failure map.
        Parameters:
        targetMap - target basic failure map to which the data are added
        additionalMap - other basic failure map from which the additional data are taken
